junior.title: INTRODUCTION TO WEB DEVELOPMENT
junior.projectDescription:
Create a Github account
From your github account create a repository
Write a short medium article where you explain in your own words, the relationship between web development and the internet
Write a simple readme using markdown. The readme should have information about you (full name, trac etc) and should have the link to your medium article
Push the readme to your repository 
Submit the link to your github repository

junior.title: HYPERTEXT MARKUP LANGUAGE
junior.projectDescription:
Now you are an HTML expert! You want the world to know about you. Build a simple personal website using only HTML. Anyone who visits this page should be able to see your image, name, bio, social media handles, a fun fact about you etc 

You have a real estate company and you want to put your business online for potential clients to find you. Create a real estate application with only HTML. The application’s landing page should tell potential clients about your business and it should also have clickable images. When a client clicks on an image of a house, the client should be directed to another page that shows the client more information about the house they clicked on.
Be creative with this!

junior.title: CASCADING STYLE SHEETS (CSS)
junior.projectDescription:
As a CSS genius, you have been contacted by President Biden to solve the hunger problem in the world. You will do this by replicating a figma design for a food website.
The goal is to employ all the tips and tricks you have learned so far to create a fully responsive replica of the design. Goodluck!

You just realized that a lot of techies worldwide live their lives on coffee. You are thinking this is an awesome business idea. You like money a lot. Now you want to start a coffee business. Build a simple responsive coffee store webpage using HTML and CSS. This store should have a homepage and should include a menu created using HTML tables. Your coffee store should also have a contact page (with a form), an about page and anything else you would love to add.
The goal is to be as creative as you can be. Your potential competition in the coffee business: https://www.coffee-page.com/

junior.title: JAVASCRIPT
junior.projectDescription:
Using just javascript, build a basic calculator that takes input from the user and performs mathematical operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.

Using just javascript, create a console app quiz game where the user is presented with a series of multiple-choice questions. Store the questions, options, and correct answers in an object or an array. Display each question, prompt the user for their answer, and provide feedback on whether their answer was correct or not. At the end of the quiz, display the user's score and the correct answers for the questions they missed.
Bonus if you can set a time limit for each question and display a countdown timer, add a feature to allow the user to create their own custom quizzes by adding questions and answers or Include different categories of questions and allow the user to select a specific category before starting the quiz.

junior.title: JAVASCRIPT DOM
junior.projectDescription:
Task One: Clone and fork the repo to see the task: https://github.com/codetivite/javascript-dom-project-1
Task Two
Clone and fork the repo to see the task: https://github.com/codetivite/javascript-dom-project-2
Task Three: Clone and fork the repo to see the task: https://github.com/codetivite/javascript-dom-project-3
Task One: Clone and fork the repo to see the task: https://github.com/codetivite/javascript-dom-project-4

entrylevel.title: NodeJs Basics
entrylevel.projectDescription: Build a simple web server using Node.js. Use the HTTP module to create a server that listens on a port and returns Hello, World! to any request.

entrylevel.title: HTTP and Express.js
entrylevel.projectDescription: Build a simple RESTful API for an NFT marketplace using Express.js. Use the express module to create a server that can:Get an NFTGet all NFTsAdd a new NFTUpdate an NFTDelete an NFTIt’s ok to use an array as your datastore here, in the next section you will look at usng mongoDBFeel free to add other functionalities you feel a marketplace should have..

entrylevel.title: MongoDB and Mongoose.js
entrylevel.projectDescription: Build a simple e-commerce RESTful API that uses MongoDB as its backend database. Implement CRUD operations for the application's data, and add support for basic text search using MongoDB's text search functionality.

entrylevel.title: Testing and Debugging
entrylevel.projectDescription: Using Mocha and Chai, write tests for the the ecommerce RESTful API you developed in the previous section using Mocha and ChaiWrite an article on the difference between Mocha and Chai

intermediate.title: Security and Performance
intermediate.projectDescription:
Implement security measures and performance optimizations for the last API project in the last section.
Acceptance Criteria.
Your API must be make use helmet
Implement rate limiting and load balancing
A proper readme to explain what you have done to improve security

intermediate.title: Advanced HTTP and ExpressJS
intermediate.projectDescription:
Build an Api for a simple real-time chat application like Whatsapp. Use WebSocket.
Acceptance Criteria
Your API must be restful
Use Socket.Io 
Proper implementation of authentication and authorization
Implement data caching using redis
A proper readme to explain what you have done

intermediate.title: Relational Databases and Sequelize
intermediate.projectDescription:
Build a RESTful API for a hotel management system using that uses Sequelize.js to interact with a PostgresSQL database.
Acceptance Criteria
Your API must be restful
Use Sequelize.js + PostgresSQL
Proper implementation of authentication and authorization
Implement data caching using redis
A proper readme to explain what you have done

advanced.title: Advanced Concepts in Node.js
advanced.projectDescription: Build a Node.js application that uses streams, child processes, and clustering to handle large amounts of data efficiently and concurrently

advanced.title: Advanced Database Management
advanced.projectDescription:
Design and implement a data warehouse for a large retail chain.
- integrate data from multiple sources
- provide complex reporting and analysis capability.
- Implement security measures and performance optimizations

advanced.title: Advanced Performance and Scalability
advanced.projectDescription: Build a scalable and performant microservices architecture with Node.js, Docker, Redis, and RabbitMQ. Implement CRUD operations for the service's data, and add support for data pagination, filtering, and sorting.

junior.title: Introduction to Product Design
junior.projectDescription: Sketch 10 different product ideas. It can be on either desktop or mobile. Snap them and attach the images to a google doc file. Then share the link to the google doc file. Do not forget to add comprehensive description for each image

junior.title: User Research and Understanding User Needs
junior.projectDescription: Conduct a user interview for a blockchain voting application and create a user persona. Submit an evidence document that comprehensively discusses all you have done

junior.title: Product Design Tools
junior.projectDescription: Create a wireframe for the blockchain voting application using Figma

junior.title: Prototyping and Testing
junior.projectDescription: Create and test a prototype of the voting application with 10 users. Submit an evidence document that comprehensively discusses all you have done

junior.title: Introduction to Hand-Off and Collaboration
junior.projectDescription: Create a clear hand-off process document outlining the key steps and responsibilities involved in transferring design between different teams and stages.

junior.title: Design Principles and Elements
junior.projectDescription: Create a design for a real time betting platform using the principles and elements learned. Submit an evidence document that comprehensively discusses all you have done

junior.title: Designing for Different Platforms
junior.projectDescription: Design an online gagdet store for a specific platform (e.g. mobile app). Submit an evidence document that comprehensively discusses all you have done

entrylevel.title: Collaborating with Developers
entrylevel.projectDescription: Collaborate with developers to ensure design decisions can be implemented within technical constraints. Conduct a retrospective to identify areas for improvement in the design and development process.

entrylevel.title: Visual Design
entrylevel.projectDescription: Design a style guide that includes typography, color palette, and iconography for a new product or feature. Implement the design system in a project by creating components and style guides.

entrylevel.title: Interaction Design
entrylevel.projectDescription: Create low-fidelity wireframes to outline the layout and functionality of a feature or product.

entrylevel.title: User-Centered Design
entrylevel.projectDescription: Conduct user interviews to understand their needs and pain points. Create user personas based on research findings.

advanced.title: User Research and Design
advanced.projectDescription: Conduct user research and create user personas, user scenarios, and wireframes for a product design project

advanced.title: Visual Design and Interaction Design
advanced.projectDescription: Create a visual design project that incorporates responsive design and micro-interactions.

advanced.title: Design Collaboration and Leadership
advanced.projectDescription: Lead a design project and facilitate a design thinking workshop.

advanced.title: Design Principles and Fundamentals
advanced.projectDescription: Create a visual design project that applies the principles of design thinking, visual hierarchy, and grid systems.

entrylevel.title: Advanced CSS
entrylevel.projectDescription:
Create an animated slideshow using CSS Grid or Flexbox. 
Design a layout that showcases a series of images or content in a slideshow format. Use CSS animations and transitions to add dynamic effects, such as sliding or fading transitions between slides. 
You can also incorporate CSS transforms to apply 3D effects or rotations to the slideshow.Add navigation buttons or indicators to control the slideshow and Implement autoplay functionality to automatically transition between slides.Using Sass create a mobile-first interactive car image gallery. Use CSS animations to create smooth transitions when hovering over the images, revealing additional information or changing the image appearance. 
Make extensive use of CSS selectors to apply different styles or animations based on the selected category or tag.

entrylevel.title: INTRODUCTION TO JAVASCRIPT FRAMEWORK
entrylevel.projectDescription:
Build a task management application using any of the JS framework above. Your application will allow users to create, update, and delete tasks, as well as mark tasks as completed. Users will have the ability to view a list of tasks and filter them based on different criteria, such as completed tasks or tasks with specific tags.
Key Features:
Users can add new tasks by providing a title, description, due date, and optional tags.
Display a list of tasks with their titles, due dates, and completion status. Tasks can be sorted based on different criteria such as due date or completion status.
Implement filters to allow users to view specific subsets of tasks, such as only completed tasks or tasks with specific tags.
Task Details: Show detailed information about each task, including the description, due date, and tags. Users can also edit or delete tasks from this view.
Task Completion: Users can mark tasks as completed or mark them as incomplete if needed.
Implement the ability to assign tags to tasks, allowing users to categorize tasks and filter them based on specific tags.

If youre feeling too bad-ass😎 (Optional):
Task Reminders: Implement notifications or reminders for upcoming task due dates.
Drag and Drop: Enable users to reorder tasks or move them between different categories using drag and drop functionality.
Task Search: Include a search feature that allows users to search for tasks based on keywords or tags.
User Authentication: Optionally, incorporate user authentication to allow users to create accounts, log in, and have their tasks associated with their accounts.

entrylevel.title: ADVANCED JAVASCRIPT
entrylevel.projectDescription: Develop a complex console application that analyzes a file system, displaying various statistics and information about files and directories. The application should traverse through directories recursively, calculate file sizes, count files and directories, and provide an overview of the file system structure. Implement advanced features like filtering based on file types or sizes and sorting options for the displayed information.\nCreate a console application for managing a music library. Allow users to add, remove, and update music tracks, create playlists, and perform advanced operations like searching for songs based on artist, album, or genre. Implement features like importing and exporting music metadata from external sources using JSON, handling file operations, and generating statistics about the music library, such as most played songs or top-rated albums.\nBuild a comprehensive console application for tracking expenses and managing personal budgets. Enable users to record their expenses, categorize them, and generate reports and visualizations to analyze their spending habits. Implement features like setting budget limits, generating alerts when expenses exceed the limits, and providing insights into spending patterns over time. Utilize advanced concepts like data persistence, data encryption, and command-line interfaces for a user-friendly experience.

intermediate.title: PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION
intermediate.projectDescription:
Revisit your Animated slideshow project and Optimize its CSS files. Identify redundant or unused CSS rules and remove them to reduce file size. Minify the CSS to eliminate unnecessary whitespace and comments. Leverage techniques like CSS sprites, font subsetting, or critical CSS to optimize rendering and loading performance. As a professional web performance optimizer, create a report showing your findings and optimizations

TASK TWO
Remember your car image gallery? Build a plugin or tool that optimizes images for web usage. 
Implement techniques like image compression, lazy loading, or responsive images to ensure optimal loading times and bandwidth usage. 
The plugin should automatically optimize images uploaded to the website and provide options for configuring the level of compression and loading behavior.

intermediate.title: WEB ACCESSIBILITY
intermediate.projectDescription:
Build an accessible web application that demonstrates the implementation of various accessibility features and techniques listed above. The project can be a simple interactive web application, such as a weather application or a football scoreboard. 
Ensure that the web application meets accessibility standards and guidelines, considering aspects like keyboard navigation, proper heading structure, alternative text for images, color contrast, form accessibility, and responsiveness for different devices.
Note: Throughout the project, it's crucial to refer to and adhere to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1, as well as consult accessibility resources and consider user feedback to ensure the highest level of accessibility in the web application.

Key Features to Implement:
Ensure that all interactive elements and functionalities can be accessed and operated using a keyboard alone.
Use appropriate HTML elements to structure the content, including headings, lists, and semantic form elements.
Alternative text: Provide descriptive alternative text for images and meaningful captions or transcripts for multimedia elements.
Form accessibility: Implement accessible forms with proper labels, error handling, and validation.
Use ARIA roles and attributes when necessary.
Responsive design: Design the web application to be responsive and accessible on different devices, considering touch interactions and screen sizes.
Focus management: Manage focus properly, ensuring that users can navigate through interactive elements easily and understand their current location on the page.
Error handling: Provide clear and descriptive error messages for form validation and other user interactions.
Testing and validation: Conduct accessibility testing using automated tools and perform manual testing with assistive technologies or by involving users with disabilities.

intermediate.title: MODERN WEB DEVELOPMENT TECHNIQUES
intermediate.projectDescription:
Build a modern web application using Progressive Web App (PWA) principles and Firebase as the backend. Create an event planning and registration platform. This platform will allow users to discover upcoming events, register for them, and receive real-time updates. The project involves the following key aspects:
Progressive Web App (PWA) Features

:Develop a responsive and mobile-friendly user interface using modern CSS frameworks like Bootstrap or Tailwind CSS.
Implement service workers to enable offline functionality, allowing users to access event information even without an internet connection.
Leverage web push notifications using Firebase Cloud Messaging to provide event reminders and updates to registered attendees.
Firebase Backend Integration:Utilize Firebase Authentication for user registration, login, and user profile management. This allows users to create accounts and securely authenticate themselves.
Use Firebase Realtime Database or Firestore to store and retrieve event data, user information, and registration details.
Leverage Firebase Cloud Functions to handle serverless backend functionalities, such as event registration and notification triggers.
Event Discovery and Registration:Create a user-friendly interface for users to browse and search upcoming events based on various criteria such as location, date, or category.
Implement event registration functionality, allowing users to sign up for events and manage their registrations.
Enable users to view event details, including location, date, time, speakers, and any associated documents or resources.
User Authentication and Profiles:Utilize Firebase Authentication to enable user authentication and secure access to the application.
Allow users to create accounts, log in, and manage their profiles.
Leverage Firebase Firestore or Realtime Database to store user-specific data, such as favorites, preferences, or past event history.
CI/CD Pipeline and Deployment:Set up a CI/CD pipeline using tools like GitHub Actions or other CI/CD services to automate the build, testing, and deployment process.
Deploy the web application to a hosting platform, such as Firebase Hosting, to make it accessible to users over the internet.

Acceptance Criteria: You should make use of best practices in frontend development, including modular architecture, code optimization, and error handling.
Ensure the application meets accessibility standards, follows responsive design principles, and is optimized for performance.

intermediate.title: TESTING AND DEBUGGING
intermediate.projectDescription:
Build a bug tracker and issue management system that allows teams to track and manage software issues and bugs. Implement features such as creating and assigning issues, tracking their status, adding comments and attachments, and generating reports. Write unit tests to ensure the correctness of the bug tracker's functionality and integration tests to validate the system's behavior across different components.
Develop an automated end-to-end testing suite for one your JS framework projects. Write tests that simulate user interactions and validate the application's functionality across multiple scenarios.
Focus on testing critical user flows, handling asynchronous operations, and reporting test results. 
Use testing Cypress and explore different testing techniques such as data-driven testing and visual regression testing.

TASK TWO

Develop a unit testing framework similar to popular frameworks like Jest or Mocha. This project will involve designing and implementing a framework that allows developers to write and execute unit tests for their code. It should support test suites, test cases, assertions, and test reporting. Focus on creating a user-friendly API and providing comprehensive test coverage.
